billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO INVESTIGATIONS AND GOVERNMENT OPERATIONS

title: Provides bicycle access to public office buildings
summary: Provides bicycle access to public office buildings for state employees, contractors and visitors; requires the commissioner of general services to make an inventory of all existing bicycle parking and storage facilities at all state office buildings and office buildings in which the state leases or occupies space.

       AN  ACT to amend the public buildings law, in relation to bicycle access
         to public office buildings

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 11 of the public buildings law, as added by chapter
    2  819  of  the laws of 1987 and subdivision 2 as amended by chapter 126 of
    3  the laws of 1988, is amended to read as follows:
    4    S 11. Pilot program of bicycle parking  facilities.    1.  Legislative
    5  finding.  In recognition of the role which bicycles can serve as a valu-
    6  able transportation mode  with  energy  conservation,  health,  PHYSICAL
    7  FITNESS  and  environmental  benefits,  it  is hereby declared to be the
    8  policy of the state that provision for adequate and safe bicycle facili-
    9  ties including the use of present facilities for safe and secure bicycle
   10  parking AND STORAGE be included  in  the  planning  [and],  development,
   11  CONSTRUCTION OR RECONSTRUCTION of all state facilities.
   12    2.  (a) The commissioner of general services shall undertake a [pilot]
   13  program for THE provision and promotion of safe and secure bicycle park-
   14  ing facilities at state office buildings FOR STATE EMPLOYEES  AND  VISI-
   15  TORS AT SUCH BUILDINGS. The commissioner[, within one year of the enact-
   16  ment  of  this  section,]  OF  GENERAL  SERVICES  shall  provide, at the
   17  principal office buildings under  his  OR  HER  superintendence  at  the
   18  Nelson  A.  Rockefeller  Empire  State Plaza in Albany, New York, secure
   19  bicycle parking facilities for use by employees and visitors.  PROVIDED,
   20  FURTHER, THAT THE COMMISSIONER OF GENERAL SERVICES SHALL MAKE AN  INVEN-
   21  TORY OF ALL EXISTING BICYCLE PARKING AND STORAGE FACILITIES AT ALL STATE
   22  OFFICE BUILDINGS AND OFFICE BUILDINGS IN WHICH THE STATE LEASES OR OCCU-
   23  PIES  SPACE.  SUCH INVENTORY SHALL BE MADE ONLY OF STATE OWNED OR LEASED

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04847-01-1

    1  BUILDINGS OR OFFICES WHICH HAVE OVER THIRTY STATE EMPLOYEES  LOCATED  AT
    2  SUCH  SITE OR IN WHICH THE VISITATION RATE BY THE GENERAL PUBLIC IS OVER
    3  FIVE HUNDRED VISITORS, ON AVERAGE, EACH MONTH. SUCH INVENTORY OF BICYCLE
    4  PARKING AND STORAGE FACILITIES SHALL BE COMPLETED WITHIN ONE YEAR OF THE
    5  EFFECTIVE  DATE  OF THE CHAPTER OF THE LAWS OF TWO THOUSAND ELEVEN WHICH
    6  AMENDED THIS SECTION.
    7    (b) The commissioner OF GENERAL SERVICES is also authorized, within  a
    8  reasonable period and where feasible, to provide suitable support facil-
    9  ities  including  clothing lockers, showers and changing facilities, and
   10  to charge a reasonable use fee.
   11    (c) For the purpose of this section, the term "bicycle parking facili-
   12  ty" means a device or enclosure, located within a building or  installa-
   13  tion,  or  conveniently  adjacent  thereto,  that  is easily accessible,
   14  clearly visible and so located as to minimize the  danger  of  theft  of
   15  bicycles.  Such  a  device  shall  consist of a parking rack, locker, or
   16  other device constructed to enable the frame and both wheels of a  bicy-
   17  cle  to  be  secured with ease by use of a padlock in a manner that will
   18  minimize the risk of theft, or an enclosure which limits access  to  the
   19  bicycles and is under observation by an attendant.
   20    3.  UPON  COMPLETION  OF  A  STATE OFFICE BUILDING BICYCLE PARKING AND
   21  STORAGE FACILITIES INVENTORY PROVIDED FOR IN PARAGRAPH (A)  OF  SUBDIVI-
   22  SION  TWO  OF  THIS  SECTION, THE COMMISSIONER OF GENERAL SERVICES SHALL
   23  DEVELOP A PLAN TO EXPAND  BICYCLE  PARKING  AND  STORAGE  FACILITIES  TO
   24  ENCOURAGE  THE USE OF SUCH FACILITIES BY STATE EMPLOYEES AND THE GENERAL
   25  PUBLIC THAT PATRONIZE SUCH FACILITIES TO CONDUCT PUBLIC  BUSINESS.  SUCH
   26  PLAN SHALL BE COMPLETED WITHIN EIGHTEEN MONTHS AFTER FINALIZATION OF THE
   27  PARKING  AND  STORAGE  FACILITIES INVENTORY. SUCH PLAN SHALL CONTAIN AND
   28  ADDRESS THE FOLLOWING ELEMENTS TO  ENCOURAGE  STATE  EMPLOYEES  AND  THE
   29  GENERAL  PUBLIC  TO  USE  BICYCLES  MORE FREQUENTLY AT EACH STATE OFFICE
   30  BUILDING FACILITY OR LEASED PREMISE:
   31    (A) THE INVENTORY OF BICYCLE PARKING AND STORAGE FACILITIES  SHALL  BE
   32  RANKED  FROM  HIGHEST TO LOWEST BASED ON THE EXISTING UNFULFILLED DEMAND
   33  FOR SUCH FACILITIES AT STATE OFFICE BUILDINGS. SUCH RANKING  SHALL  ALSO
   34  CONSIDER  INCREASED  FUTURE DEMAND OR THE POTENTIAL FOR INCREASED FUTURE
   35  DEMAND OF SUCH PARKING AND STORAGE FACILITIES;
   36    (B) IN URBAN SETTINGS, THERE SHALL BE  A  PLAN  TO  DEVELOP  AN  AMPLE
   37  SUPPLY  OF  SECURE  COVERED AND UNCOVERED OFF-STREET BICYCLE PARKING AND
   38  STORAGE OR ALTERNATE INDOOR PARKING OR STORAGE FOR SUCH BICYCLES;
   39    (C) ADEQUATE POSTING OF SUCH BICYCLE PARKING  AND  STORAGE  FACILITIES
   40  SHALL  BE  PROVIDED  FOR  AND  PLACED  AROUND SUCH STATE OFFICE BUILDING
   41  FACILITY TO ENCOURAGE UTILIZATION OF SUCH PARKING AND STORAGE FACILITIES
   42  BY STATE EMPLOYEES AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC;
   43    (D) A MARKETING PLAN AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH EFFORT SHALL  PROVIDE  FOR
   44  THE  DISSEMINATION  OF INFORMATION TO STATE EMPLOYEES, VISITORS TO STATE
   45  OFFICE BUILDINGS, AND TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC TO ENCOURAGE INDIVIDUALS  TO
   46  USE BICYCLES WHEN TRAVELING TO SUCH BUILDINGS OR FACILITIES; AND
   47    (E) THE COMMISSIONER OF GENERAL SERVICES SHALL INCLUDE AND ADDRESS ANY
   48  OTHER ELEMENT IN THE PLAN AS HE OR SHE DEEMS APPROPRIATE.
   49    [3]  4.  In  undertaking  such  [pilot] program, the office OF GENERAL
   50  SERVICES shall:  (a) Consult with and cooperate with (i) [the  statewide
   51  bicycle  advisory council, (ii)] the New York state department of trans-
   52  portation regional bicycle  coordinator[,  (iii)];  (II)  local  bicycle
   53  planning  groups[,]; and [(iv)] (III) persons, organizations, and groups
   54  served by, interested in, or concerned with the area under study.
   55    (b) Request and receive from any department, division, board,  bureau,
   56  commission  or  other  agency  of the state or any political subdivision

       S. 625                              3

    1  thereof or any public authority, any  assistance  and  data  as  may  be
    2  necessary  to  enable  the  office  OF GENERAL SERVICES to carry out its
    3  responsibilities under this section.
    4    [(c)  On  or before the first day of January, nineteen hundred eighty-
    5  nine, a report shall be submitted to the governor  and  the  legislature
    6  which shall include a determination of usage levels, a statement outlin-
    7  ing  first  year  progress  and the elements of a statewide plan for the
    8  provision of such facilities.]
    9    5. NOTHING IN THIS SECTION SHALL BE CONSTRUED TO REQUIRE THE STATE  OR
   10  THE OWNER, LESSEE, MANAGER OR OTHER PERSON WHO IS IN CONTROL OF A BUILD-
   11  ING  GOVERNED  BY  THIS  SECTION TO PROVIDE SPACE FOR STORED BICYCLES AT
   12  SUCH BUILDING OR BROUGHT INTO SUCH BUILDING OR TO PERMIT A BICYCLE TO BE
   13  PARKED IN A MANNER THAT VIOLATES BUILDING OR FIRE  CODES  OR  ANY  OTHER
   14  APPLICABLE  LAW,  RULE  OR  CODE,  OR WHICH OTHERWISE IMPEDES INGRESS OR
   15  EGRESS TO SUCH BUILDING.
   16    6. THERE IS HEREBY ESTABLISHED  A  TEMPORARY  BICYCLE  COMMUTING  TASK
   17  FORCE  TO EXAMINE THE DEVELOPMENT OF SHELTERED BICYCLE PARKING IN PUBLIC
   18  SPACES.
   19    (A) SUCH TASK FORCE SHALL BE COMPRISED OF NINE MEMBERS, INCLUDING  THE
   20  COMMISSIONER  OF  GENERAL  SERVICES, THE COMMISSIONER OF TRANSPORTATION,
   21  THE COMMISSIONER OF MOTOR VEHICLES, THE COMMISSIONER  OF  BUILDINGS  AND
   22  THE  COMMISSIONER  OF  PARKS  AND  RECREATION  OR A DESIGNEE OF ANY SUCH
   23  COMMISSIONERS. THE REMAINING FOUR MEMBERS SHALL CONSIST OF  A  GROUP  OF
   24  MUNICIPAL   PLANNERS,   BICYCLE  ASSOCIATION  REPRESENTATIVES,  BUILDING
   25  CONTRACTORS AND ENGINEERS.   THEY SHALL BE  APPOINTED  AS  FOLLOWS:  ONE
   26  MEMBER  SHALL BE APPOINTED BY THE TEMPORARY PRESIDENT OF THE SENATE; ONE
   27  MEMBER SHALL BE APPOINTED BY THE MINORITY  LEADER  OF  THE  SENATE;  ONE
   28  MEMBER SHALL BE APPOINTED BY THE SPEAKER OF THE ASSEMBLY; AND ONE MEMBER
   29  SHALL BE APPOINTED BY THE MINORITY LEADER OF THE ASSEMBLY.
   30    (B)  THE  CHAIR OF THE TEMPORARY BICYCLE COMMUTING TASK FORCE SHALL BE
   31  THE COMMISSIONER OF GENERAL SERVICES. MEMBERS OF THE  TEMPORARY  BICYCLE
   32  COMMUTING  TASK  FORCE  SHALL  SERVE WITHOUT COMPENSATION AND SHALL MEET
   33  WHEN DEEMED NECESSARY BY THE CHAIR.
   34    (C) WITHIN EIGHTEEN MONTHS OF THE  TEMPORARY  BICYCLE  COMMUTING  TASK
   35  FORCE'S  ESTABLISHMENT,  SUCH  TASK  FORCE  SHALL  ISSUE A REPORT TO THE
   36  GOVERNOR AND THE LEGISLATURE. SUCH REPORT  SHALL  INCLUDE,  BUT  NOT  BE
   37  LIMITED TO (I) AN ASSESSMENT OF THE DEMAND FOR SHELTERED BICYCLE PARKING
   38  IN  PUBLIC  SPACES;  (II)  AN EXAMINATION OF THE MARKETING AND COMMUNITY
   39  OUTREACH EFFORTS NEEDED TO ENCOURAGE THE USE OF BICYCLES;  (III)  RECOM-
   40  MENDATIONS  ON  ESTABLISHING PARTNERSHIPS WITH ENTITIES TO DEVELOP SHEL-
   41  TERED BICYCLE STORAGE AND PARKING FACILITIES IN PUBLIC SPACES; AND  (IV)
   42  SUGGESTIONS ON EXPANDING THE OFFICE OF GENERAL SERVICES TO LOCAL MUNICI-
   43  PAL  AND  PRIVATE  OFFICE  BUILDINGS. SUCH REPORT SHALL BE POSTED ON THE
   44  WEBSITE OF EACH STATE AGENCY THAT WAS A MEMBER OF SUCH TASK FORCE WITHIN
   45  TWENTY DAYS FROM ITS SUBMISSION TO THE GOVERNOR. THE  TEMPORARY  BICYCLE
   46  COMMUTING  TASK  FORCE SHALL CEASE TO EXIST THREE MONTHS AFTER THE ISSU-
   47  ANCE OF ITS REPORT.
   48    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
